title: 115_hr541
content: The Act is titled the "Improving Oversight and Accountability in Medicaid Non-DSH Supplemental Payments Act." It aims to enhance the calculation, oversight, and accountability of non-DSH supplemental payments under the Medicaid program. The Act "Improving Oversight and Accountability in Medicaid Non-DSH Supplemental Payments Act" amends Section 1903 of the Social Security Act to provide guidance to States on calculating non-DSH supplemental payments to providers and establish reporting requirements for such payments. The Act "Improving Oversight and Accountability in Medicaid Non-DSH Supplemental Payments Act" requires detailed reporting of non-DSH supplemental payments made to various types of healthcare providers. The Act "Improving Oversight and Accountability in Medicaid Non-DSH Supplemental Payments Act" mandates that States must provide detailed information and conduct annual audits to ensure that non-DSH supplemental payments to healthcare providers align with federal guidelines. The Act mandates States to provide detailed information and conduct audits to ensure non-DSH supplemental payments to healthcare providers comply with federal laws. Non-DSH supplemental payments are additional payments made by States to providers for services rendered to eligible individuals under the State plan. The Act requires States to report and audit non-DSH supplemental payments to healthcare providers to ensure compliance with federal laws.
